info.title: OANDA v20 REST API
info.description: The full OANDA v20 REST API Specification. This specification defines how to interact with v20 Accounts, Trades, Orders, Pricing and more.

get.description: Fetch candlestick data for an instrument.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The Price component(s) to get candlestick data for. Can contain any combination of the characters "M" (midpoint candles) "B" (bid candles) and "A" (ask candles).

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity of the candlesticks to fetch

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of candlesticks to return in the reponse. Count should not be specified if both the start and end parameters are provided, as the time range combined with the graularity will determine the number of candlesticks to return.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the time range to fetch candlesticks for.
parameters.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end of the time range to fetch candlesticks for.
parameters.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

parameters.name: smooth
parameters.description: A flag that controls whether the candlestick is "smoothed" or not.  A smoothed candlestick uses the previous candle's close price as its open price, while an unsmoothed candlestick uses the first price from its time range as its open price.

parameters.name: includeFirst
parameters.description: A flag that controls whether the candlestick that is covered by the from time should be included in the results. This flag enables clients to use the timestamp of the last completed candlestick received to poll for future candlesticks but avoid receiving the previous candlestick repeatedly.

parameters.name: dailyAlignment
parameters.description: The hour of the day (in the specified timezone) to use for granularities that have daily alignments.

parameters.name: alignmentTimezone
parameters.description: The timezone to use for the dailyAlignment parameter. Candlesticks with daily alignment will be aligned to the dailyAlignment hour within the alignmentTimezone.  Note that the returned times will still be represented in UTC.

parameters.name: weeklyAlignment
parameters.description: The day of the week used for granularities that have weekly alignment.

200.description: Pricing information has been successfully provided.

RequestID.description: The unique identifier generated for the request

instrument.description: The instrument whose Prices are represented by the candlesticks.
instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

granularity.description: The granularity of the candlesticks provided.

candles.description: The list of candlesticks that satisfy the request.

get.description: Fetch a price for an instrument. Accounts are not associated in any way with this endpoint.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time at which the desired price is in effect. The current price is returned if no time is provided.
parameters.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

200.description: Pricing information has been successfully provided.

RequestID.description: The unique identifier generated for the request

parameters.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). get.description: Fetch an order book for an instrument.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time of the snapshot to fetch. If not specified, then the most recent snapshot is fetched.
parameters.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

Content-Encoding.description: Value will be "gzip" regardless of provided Accept-Encoding header

Link.description: A link to the next/previous order book snapshot.

RequestID.description: The unique identifier generated for the request

put.description: Closeout the open Position for a specific instrument in an Account.

parameters.name: closePositionBody
parameters.description: Representation of how to close the position

longUnits.description: Indication of how much of the long Position to closeout. Either the string "ALL", the string "NONE", or a DecimalNumber representing how many units of the long position to close using a PositionCloseout MarketOrder. The units specified must always be positive.

shortUnits.description: Indication of how much of the short Position to closeout. Either the string "ALL", the string "NONE", or a DecimalNumber representing how many units of the short position to close using a PositionCloseout MarketOrder. The units specified must always be positive.

200.description: The Position closeout request has been successfully processed.

Location.description: A link to the Position that was just closed out

relatedTransactionIDs.description: The IDs of all Transactions that were created while satisfying the request.

lastTransactionID.description: The ID of the most recent Transaction created for the Account
lastTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

get.description: Get a list of Trades for an Account

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: List of Trade IDs to retrieve.

parameters.description: The state to filter the requested Trades by.

parameters.name: instrument
parameters.description: The instrument to filter the requested Trades by.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of Trades to return.

parameters.name: beforeID
parameters.description: The maximum Trade ID to return. If not provided the most recent Trades in the Account are returned.
parameters.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

200.description: The list of Trades requested

Link.description: A link to the next page of Trades if the results were paginated

RequestID.description: The unique identifier generated for the request

trades.description: The list of Trade detail objects

lastTransactionID.description: The ID of the most recent Transaction created for the Account

put.description: Close (partially or fully) a specific open Trade in an Account

parameters.name: closeTradeBody

units.description: Indication of how much of the Trade to close. Either the string "ALL" (indicating that all of the Trade should be closed), or a DecimalNumber representing the number of units of the open Trade to Close using a TradeClose MarketOrder. get.description: Get a stream of Transactions for an Account starting from when the request is made.

200.description: Connecting to the Transaction Stream was successful.

RequestID.description: The unique identifier generated for the request

schema.description:
The response body for the Transaction Stream uses chunked transfer encoding.  Each chunk contains Transaction and/or TransactionHeartbeat objects encoded as JSON.  Each JSON object is serialized into a single line of text, and multiple objects found in the same chunk are separated by newlines.
TransactionHeartbeats are sent every 5 seconds.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Date/Time filter to apply to the response. Only prices and home conversions (if requested) with a time later than this filter (i.e. the price has changed after the since time) will be provided, and are filtered independently.
parameters.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. parameters.description: Flag that enables the inclusion of the homeConversions field in the returned response. An entry will be returned for each currency in the set of all base and quote currencies present in the requested instruments list.

homeConversions.description: The list of home currency conversion factors requested. This field will only be present if includeHomeConversions was set to true in the request.

The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

get.description:
Get a stream of Account Prices starting from when the request is made.
This pricing stream does not include every single price created for the Account, but instead will provide at most 4 prices per second (every 250 milliseconds) for each instrument being requested.
If more than one price is created for an instrument during the 250 millisecond window, only the price in effect at the end of the window is sent. This means that during periods of rapid price movement, subscribers to this stream will not be sent every price.
Pricing windows for different connections to the price stream are not all aligned in the same way (i.e. they are not all aligned to the top of the second). This means that during periods of rapid price movement, different subscribers may observe different prices depending on their alignment.

parameters.name: instruments
parameters.description: List of Instruments to stream Prices for.

items.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

parameters.name: snapshot

200.description: Connecting to the Price Stream was successful.

Link.description: A link to the next/previous order book snapshot.

RequestID.description: The unique identifier generated for the request

schema.description:
The response body for the Pricing Stream uses chunked transfer encoding.  Each chunk contains Price and/or PricingHeartbeat objects encoded as JSON.  Each JSON object is serialized into a single line of text, and multiple objects found in the same chunk are separated by newlines.
Heartbeats are sent every 5 seconds.

get.description: Fetch candlestick data for an instrument.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The Price component(s) to get candlestick data for. Can contain any combination of the characters "M" (midpoint candles) "B" (bid candles) and "A" (ask candles).

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity of the candlesticks to fetch

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of candlesticks to return in the response. Count should not be specified if both the start and end parameters are provided, as the time range combined with the granularity will determine the number of candlesticks to return.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the time range to fetch candlesticks for.
parameters.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end of the time range to fetch candlesticks for.
parameters.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

parameters.name: smooth
parameters.description: A flag that controls whether the candlestick is "smoothed" or not.  A smoothed candlestick uses the previous candle's close price as its open price, while an unsmoothed candlestick uses the first price from its time range as its open price.

parameters.name: includeFirst
parameters.description: A flag that controls whether the candlestick that is covered by the from time should be included in the results. This flag enables clients to use the timestamp of the last completed candlestick received to poll for future candlesticks but avoid receiving the previous candlestick repeatedly.

parameters.name: dailyAlignment
parameters.description: The hour of the day (in the specified timezone) to use for granularities that have daily alignments.

parameters.name: alignmentTimezone
parameters.description: The timezone to use for the dailyAlignment parameter. Candlesticks with daily alignment will be aligned to the dailyAlignment hour within the alignmentTimezone.  Note that the returned times will still be represented in UTC.

parameters.name: weeklyAlignment
parameters.description: The day of the week used for granularities that have weekly alignment.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: The number of units used to calculate the volume-weighted average bid and ask prices in the returned candles.
parameters.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

200.description: Pricing information has been successfully provided.

RequestID.description: The unique identifier generated for the request

instrument.description: The instrument whose Prices are represented by the candlesticks.
instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

granularity.description: The granularity of the candlesticks provided.

candles.description: The list of candlesticks that satisfy the request.

MarketOrderTransaction.description:
A MarketOrderTransaction represents the creation of a Market Order in the user's account. A Market Order is an Order that is filled immediately at the current market price.
Market Orders can be specialized when they are created to accomplish a specific task: to close a Trade, to closeout a Position or to particiate in in a Margin closeout.

id.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

time.description: The date/time when the Transaction was created.
time.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

userID.description: The ID of the user that initiated the creation of the Transaction.

accountID.description: The ID of the Account the Transaction was created for.

batchID.description: The ID of the "batch" that the Transaction belongs to. Transactions in the same batch are applied to the Account simultaneously.
batchID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

requestID.description: The Request ID of the request which generated the transaction.

type.description: The Type of the Transaction. Always set to "MARKET_ORDER" in a MarketOrderTransaction.

instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

units.description: The quantity requested to be filled by the Market Order. A posititive number of units results in a long Order, and a negative number of units results in a short Order.
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

timeInForce.description: The time-in-force requested for the Market Order. Restricted to FOK or IOC for a MarketOrder.

priceBound.description: The worst price that the client is willing to have the Market Order filled at.
priceBound.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

positionFill.description: Specification of how Positions in the Account are modified when the Order is filled.

reason.description: The reason that the Market Order was created

triggerCondition.description:
Specification of which price component should be used when determining if an Order should be triggered and filled. This allows Orders to be triggered based on the bid, ask, mid, default (ask for buy, bid for sell) or inverse (ask for sell, bid for buy) price depending on the desired behaviour. Orders are always filled using their default price component.
This feature is only provided through the REST API. Clients who choose to specify a non-default trigger condition will not see it reflected in any of OANDA's proprietary or partner trading platforms, their transaction history or their account statements. OANDA platforms always assume that an Order's trigger condition is set to the default value when indicating the distance from an Order's trigger price, and will always provide the default trigger condition when creating or modifying an Order.
A special restriction applies when creating a guaranteed Stop Loss Order. In this case the TriggerCondition value must either be "DEFAULT", or the "natural" trigger side "DEFAULT" results in. So for a Stop Loss Order for a long trade valid values are "DEFAULT" and "BID", and for short trades "DEFAULT" and "ASK" are valid.

reason.description: The reason that the Limit Order was initiated

replacesOrderID.description: The ID of the Order that this Order replaces (only provided if this Order replaces an existing Order).
replacesOrderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

cancellingTransactionID.description: The ID of the Transaction that cancels the replaced Order (only provided if this Order replaces an existing Order).
cancellingTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

units.description: The quantity requested to be filled by the MarketIfTouched Order. A posititive number of units results in a long Order, and a negative number of units results in a short Order.
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

price.description: The price threshold specified for the MarketIfTouched Order. The MarketIfTouched Order will only be filled by a market price that crosses this price from the direction of the market price at the time when the Order was created (the initialMarketPrice). Depending on the value of the Order's price and initialMarketPrice, the MarketIfTouchedOrder will behave like a Limit or a Stop Order.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

priceBound.description: The worst market price that may be used to fill this MarketIfTouched Order.
priceBound.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

timeInForce.description: The time-in-force requested for the MarketIfTouched Order. Restricted to "GTC", "GFD" and "GTD" for MarketIfTouched Orders.

gtdTime.description: The date/time when the MarketIfTouched Order will be cancelled if its timeInForce is "GTD".
gtdTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

positionFill.description: Specification of how Positions in the Account are modified when the Order is filled.

triggerCondition.description:
Specification of which price component should be used when determining if an Order should be triggered and filled. This allows Orders to be triggered based on the bid, ask, mid, default (ask for buy, bid for sell) or inverse (ask for sell, bid for buy) price depending on the desired behaviour. Orders are always filled using their default price component.
This feature is only provided through the REST API. Clients who choose to specify a non-default trigger condition will not see it reflected in any of OANDA's proprietary or partner trading platforms, their transaction history or their account statements. OANDA platforms always assume that an Order's trigger condition is set to the default value when indicating the distance from an Order's trigger price, and will always provide the default trigger condition when creating or modifying an Order.
A special restriction applies when creating a guaranteed Stop Loss Order. In this case the TriggerCondition value must either be "DEFAULT", or the "natural" trigger side "DEFAULT" results in. So for a Stop Loss Order for a long trade valid values are "DEFAULT" and "BID", and for short trades "DEFAULT" and "ASK" are valid.

reason.description: The reason that the Market-if-touched Order was initiated

replacesOrderID.description: The ID of the Order that this Order replaces (only provided if this Order replaces an existing Order).
replacesOrderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

cancellingTransactionID.description: The ID of the Transaction that cancels the replaced Order (only provided if this Order replaces an existing Order).
cancellingTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

units.description: The quantity requested to be filled by the MarketIfTouched Order. A posititive number of units results in a long Order, and a negative number of units results in a short Order.

price.description: The price threshold specified for the MarketIfTouched Order. The MarketIfTouched Order will only be filled by a market price that crosses this price from the direction of the market price at the time when the Order was created (the initialMarketPrice). Depending on the value of the Order's price and initialMarketPrice, the MarketIfTouchedOrder will behave like a Limit or a Stop Order.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

priceBound.description: The worst market price that may be used to fill this MarketIfTouched Order.

The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

triggerCondition.description:
Specification of which price component should be used when determining if an Order should be triggered and filled. This allows Orders to be triggered based on the bid, ask, mid, default (ask for buy, bid for sell) or inverse (ask for sell, bid for buy) price depending on the desired behaviour. Orders are always filled using their default price component.
This feature is only provided through the REST API. Clients who choose to specify a non-default trigger condition will not see it reflected in any of OANDA's proprietary or partner trading platforms, their transaction history or their account statements. OANDA platforms always assume that an Order's trigger condition is set to the default value when indicating the distance from an Order's trigger price, and will always provide the default trigger condition when creating or modifying an Order.
A special restriction applies when creating a guaranteed Stop Loss Order. In this case the TriggerCondition value must either be "DEFAULT", or the "natural" trigger side "DEFAULT" results in. So for a Stop Loss Order for a long trade valid values are "DEFAULT" and "BID", and for short trades "DEFAULT" and "ASK" are valid.

reason.description: The reason that the Trailing Stop Loss Order was initiated

orderFillTransactionID.description: The ID of the OrderFill Transaction that caused this Order to be created (only provided if this Order was created automatically when another Order was filled).

intendedReplacesOrderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

rejectReason.description: The reason that the Reject Transaction was created

time.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

accountID.description: The ID of the Account the Transaction was created for.

batchID.description: The ID of the "batch" that the Transaction belongs to. Transactions in the same batch are applied to the Account simultaneously.
batchID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

requestID.description: The Request ID of the request which generated the transaction.

type.description: The Type of the Transaction. Always set to "ORDER_FILL" for an OrderFillTransaction.

orderID.description: The ID of the Order filled.
orderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

clientOrderID.description: The client Order ID of the Order filled (only provided if the client has assigned one).

instrument.description: The name of the filled Order's instrument.
instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

units.description: The number of units filled by the OrderFill.
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

gainQuoteHomeConversionFactor.description: This is the conversion factor in effect for the Account at the time of the OrderFill for converting any gains realized in Instrument quote units into units of the Account's home currency.
gainQuoteHomeConversionFactor.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

lossQuoteHomeConversionFactor.description: This is the conversion factor in effect for the Account at the time of the OrderFill for converting any losses realized in Instrument quote units into units of the Account's home currency.
lossQuoteHomeConversionFactor.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

price.description: This field is now deprecated and should no longer be used. The individual tradesClosed, tradeReduced and tradeOpened fields contain the exact/official price each unit was filled at.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

fullVWAP.description: The price that all of the units of the OrderFill should have been filled at, in the absence of guaranteed price execution. This factors in the Account's current ClientPrice, used liquidity and the units of the OrderFill only. If no Trades were closed with their price clamped for guaranteed stop loss enforcement, then this value will match the price fields of each Trade opened, closed, and reduced, and they will all be the exact same.
fullVWAP.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

reason.description: The reason that an Order was filled

pl.description: The profit or loss incurred when the Order was filled.
pl.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

financing.description: The financing paid or collected when the Order was filled.
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

commission.description: The commission charged in the Account's home currency as a result of filling the Order. The commission is always represented as a positive quantity of the Account's home currency, however it reduces the balance in the Account.
commission.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

guaranteedExecutionFee.description: The total guaranteed execution fees charged for all Trades opened, closed or reduced with guaranteed Stop Loss Orders.
guaranteedExecutionFee.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

accountBalance.description: The Account's balance after the Order was filled.
accountBalance.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

tradesClosed.description: The Trades that were closed when the Order was filled (only provided if filling the Order resulted in a closing open Trades).

halfSpreadCost.description: The half spread cost for the OrderFill, which is the sum of the halfSpreadCost values in the tradeOpened, tradesClosed and tradeReduced fields. This can be a positive or negative value and is represented in the home currency of the Account.
halfSpreadCost.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

ClientID.description: A client-provided identifier, used by clients to refer to their Orders or Trades with an identifier that they have provided.

ClientTag.description: A client-provided tag that can contain any data and may be assigned to their Orders or Trades. Tags are typically used to associate groups of Trades and/or Orders together.

ClientComment.description: A client-provided comment that can contain any data and may be assigned to their Orders or Trades. Comments are typically used to provide extra context or meaning to an Order or Trade.

ClientExtensions.description: A ClientExtensions object allows a client to attach a clientID, tag and comment to Orders and Trades in their Account.  Do not set, modify, or delete this field if your account is associated with MT4.

id.description: The Client ID of the Order/Trade

tag.description: A tag associated with the Order/Trade

comment.description: A comment associated with the Order/Trade

TakeProfitDetails.description: TakeProfitDetails specifies the details of a Take Profit Order to be created on behalf of a client. This may happen when an Order is filled that opens a Trade requiring a Take Profit, or when a Trade's dependent Take Profit Order is modified directly through the Trade.

price.description: The price that the Take Profit Order will be triggered at. Only one of the price and distance fields may be specified.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

timeInForce.description: The time in force for the created Take Profit Order. This may only be GTC, GTD or GFD.

gtdTime.description: The date when the Take Profit Order will be cancelled on if timeInForce is GTD.
gtdTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

StopLossDetails.description: StopLossDetails specifies the details of a Stop Loss Order to be created on behalf of a client. This may happen when an Order is filled that opens a Trade requiring a Stop Loss, or when a Trade's dependent Stop Loss Order is modified directly through the Trade.

price.description: The price that the Stop Loss Order will be triggered at. Only one of the price and distance fields may be specified.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

distance.description: Specifies the distance (in price units) from the Trade's open price to use as the Stop Loss Order price. Only one of the distance and price fields may be specified.
distance.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

timeInForce.description: The time in force for the created Stop Loss Order. This may only be GTC, GTD or GFD.

gtdTime.description: The date when the Stop Loss Order will be cancelled on if timeInForce is GTD.
gtdTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

guaranteed.description: Flag indicating that the price for the Stop Loss Order is guaranteed. The default value depends on the GuaranteedStopLossOrderMode of the account, if it is REQUIRED, the default will be true, for DISABLED or ENABLED the default is false.

TrailingStopLossDetails.description: TrailingStopLossDetails specifies the details of a Trailing Stop Loss Order to be created on behalf of a client. This may happen when an Order is filled that opens a Trade requiring a Trailing Stop Loss, or when a Trade's dependent Trailing Stop Loss Order is modified directly through the Trade.

distance.description: The distance (in price units) from the Trade's fill price that the Trailing Stop Loss Order will be triggered at.
distance.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

timeInForce.description: The time in force for the created Trailing Stop Loss Order. This may only be GTC, GTD or GFD.

gtdTime.description: The date when the Trailing Stop Loss Order will be cancelled on if timeInForce is GTD.
gtdTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

TradeOpen.description: A TradeOpen object represents a Trade for an instrument that was opened in an Account. It is found embedded in Transactions that affect the position of an instrument in the Account, specifically the OrderFill Transaction.

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade that was opened
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

units.description: The number of units opened by the Trade
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

price.description: The average price that the units were opened at.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

guaranteedExecutionFee.description: This is the fee charged for opening the trade if it has a guaranteed Stop Loss Order attached to it.
guaranteedExecutionFee.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

halfSpreadCost.description: The half spread cost for the trade open. This can be a positive or negative value and is represented in the home currency of the Account.
halfSpreadCost.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

initialMarginRequired.description: The margin required at the time the Trade was created. Note, this is the 'pure' margin required, it is not the 'effective' margin used that factors in the trade risk if a GSLO is attached to the trade.
initialMarginRequired.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

TradeReduce.description: A TradeReduce object represents a Trade for an instrument that was reduced (either partially or fully) in an Account. It is found embedded in Transactions that affect the position of an instrument in the account, specifically the OrderFill Transaction.

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade that was reduced or closed
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

units.description: The number of units that the Trade was reduced by
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

price.description: The average price that the units were closed at. This price may be clamped for guaranteed Stop Loss Orders.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

realizedPL.description: The PL realized when reducing the Trade
realizedPL.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

financing.description: The financing paid/collected when reducing the Trade
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

guaranteedExecutionFee.description: This is the fee that is charged for closing the Trade if it has a guaranteed Stop Loss Order attached to it.
guaranteedExecutionFee.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

halfSpreadCost.description: The half spread cost for the trade reduce/close. This can be a positive or negative value and is represented in the home currency of the Account.
halfSpreadCost.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

MarketOrderTradeClose.description: A MarketOrderTradeClose specifies the extensions to a Market Order that has been created specifically to close a Trade.

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade requested to be closed
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

clientTradeID.description: The client ID of the Trade requested to be closed

units.description: Indication of how much of the Trade to close. Either "ALL", or a DecimalNumber reflection a partial close of the Trade.

MarketOrderMarginCloseout.description: Details for the Market Order extensions specific to a Market Order placed that is part of a Market Order Margin Closeout in a client's account

reason.description: The reason the Market Order was created to perform a margin closeout

MarketOrderMarginCloseoutReason.description: The reason that the Market Order was created to perform a margin closeout

MarketOrderDelayedTradeClose.description: Details for the Market Order extensions specific to a Market Order placed with the intent of fully closing a specific open trade that should have already been closed but wasn't due to halted market conditions

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade being closed
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

clientTradeID.description: The Client ID of the Trade being closed
clientTradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

sourceTransactionID.description: The Transaction ID of the DelayedTradeClosure transaction to which this Delayed Trade Close belongs to
sourceTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

MarketOrderPositionCloseout.description: A MarketOrderPositionCloseout specifies the extensions to a Market Order when it has been created to closeout a specific Position.

instrument.description: The instrument of the Position being closed out.
instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

units.description: Indication of how much of the Position to close. Either "ALL", or a DecimalNumber reflection a partial close of the Trade. The DecimalNumber must always be positive, and represent a number that doesn't exceed the absolute size of the Position.

LiquidityRegenerationSchedule.description: A LiquidityRegenerationSchedule indicates how liquidity that is used when filling an Order for an instrument is regenerated following the fill.  A liquidity regeneration schedule will be in effect until the timestamp of its final step, but may be replaced by a schedule created for an Order of the same instrument that is filled while it is still in effect.

steps.description: The steps in the Liquidity Regeneration Schedule

LiquidityRegenerationScheduleStep.description: A liquidity regeneration schedule Step indicates the amount of bid and ask liquidity that is used by the Account at a certain time. These amounts will only change at the timestamp of the following step.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the schedule step.
timestamp.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

bidLiquidityUsed.description: The amount of bid liquidity used at this step in the schedule.
bidLiquidityUsed.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

askLiquidityUsed.description: The amount of ask liquidity used at this step in the schedule.
askLiquidityUsed.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

OpenTradeFinancing.description: OpenTradeFinancing is used to pay/collect daily financing charge for an open Trade within an Account

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade that financing is being paid/collected for.
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

financing.description: The amount of financing paid/collected for the Trade.
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

PositionFinancing.description: OpenTradeFinancing is used to pay/collect daily financing charge for a Position within an Account

instrument.description: The instrument of the Position that financing is being paid/collected for.
instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

financing.description: The amount of financing paid/collected for the Position.
financing.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Account's home currency.

openTradeFinancings.description: The financing paid/collecte for each open Trade within the Position.

RequestID.description: The request identifier.

TransactionRejectReason.description: The reason that a Transaction was rejected.

TransactionFilter.description: A filter that can be used when fetching Transactions

TransactionHeartbeat.description: A TransactionHeartbeat object is injected into the Transaction stream to ensure that the HTTP connection remains active.

type.description: The string "HEARTBEAT"

lastTransactionID.description: The ID of the most recent Transaction created for the Account
lastTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

time.description: The date/time when the TransactionHeartbeat was created.
time.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

UserSpecifier.description: The specifier that refers to a User
UserSpecifier.format: A user specifier may have one of 3 formats: the OANDA-assigned User ID (numerical), the client-provided username prefixed by the "@" symbol (e.g. "@myusername"), or the "@" symbol. The "@" symbol on its own acts as an alias for the username of the user accessing the endpoint (as inferred from the token provided).

UserInfo.description: A representation of user information, as provided to the user themself.

userID.description: The user's OANDA-assigned user ID.

country.description: The country that the user is based in.

UserInfoExternal.description: A representation of user information, as available to external (3rd party) clients.

userID.description: The user's OANDA-assigned user ID.

country.description: The country that the user is based in.

FIFO.description: Flag indicating if the the user's Accounts adhere to FIFO execution rules.

ClientPrice.description: The specification of an Account-specific Price.

type.description: The string "PRICE". Used to identify the a Price object when found in a stream.

instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

time.description: The date/time when the Price was created
time.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

tradeable.description: Flag indicating if the Price is tradeable or not

bids.description: The list of prices and liquidity available on the Instrument's bid side. It is possible for this list to be empty if there is no bid liquidity currently available for the Instrument in the Account.

asks.description: The list of prices and liquidity available on the Instrument's ask side. It is possible for this list to be empty if there is no ask liquidity currently available for the Instrument in the Account.

closeoutBid.description: The closeout bid Price. This Price is used when a bid is required to closeout a Position (margin closeout or manual) yet there is no bid liquidity. The closeout bid is never used to open a new position.
closeoutBid.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

closeoutAsk.description: The closeout ask Price. This Price is used when a ask is required to closeout a Position (margin closeout or manual) yet there is no ask liquidity. The closeout ask is never used to open a new position.
closeoutAsk.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

QuoteHomeConversionFactors.description: QuoteHomeConversionFactors represents the factors that can be used used to convert quantities of a Price's Instrument's quote currency into the Account's home currency.

positiveUnits.description: The factor used to convert a positive amount of the Price's Instrument's quote currency into a positive amount of the Account's home currency.  Conversion is performed by multiplying the quote units by the conversion factor.
positiveUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

negativeUnits.description: The factor used to convert a negative amount of the Price's Instrument's quote currency into a negative amount of the Account's home currency.  Conversion is performed by multiplying the quote units by the conversion factor.
negativeUnits.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

HomeConversions.description: HomeConversions represents the factors to use to convert quantities of a given currency into the Account's home currency. The conversion factor depends on the scenario the conversion is required for.

currency.description: The currency to be converted into the home currency.
currency.format: A string containing an ISO 4217 currency (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)

accountGain.description: The factor used to convert any gains for an Account in the specified currency into the Account's home currency. This would include positive realized P/L and positive financing amounts. Conversion is performed by multiplying the positive P/L by the conversion factor.
accountGain.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

accountLoss.description: The string representation of a decimal number.
accountLoss.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

positionValue.description: The factor used to convert a Position or Trade Value in the specified currency into the Account's home currency. Conversion is performed by multiplying the Position or Trade Value by the conversion factor.
positionValue.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

PricingHeartbeat.description: A PricingHeartbeat object is injected into the Pricing stream to ensure that the HTTP connection remains active.

type.description: The string "HEARTBEAT"

time.description: The date/time when the Heartbeat was created.
time.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

OrderID.description: The Order's identifier, unique within the Order's Account.
OrderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

OrderState.description: The current state of the Order.

OrderStateFilter.description: The state to filter the requested Orders by.

OrderIdentifier.description: An OrderIdentifier is used to refer to an Order, and contains both the OrderID and the ClientOrderID.

orderID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

OrderSpecifier.description: The specification of an Order as referred to by clients
OrderSpecifier.format: Either the Order's OANDA-assigned OrderID or the Order's client-provided ClientID prefixed by the "@" symbol

TimeInForce.description: The time-in-force of an Order. TimeInForce describes how long an Order should remain pending before being automatically cancelled by the execution system.

OrderPositionFill.description: Specification of how Positions in the Account are modified when the Order is filled.

OrderTriggerCondition.description:
Specification of which price component should be used when determining if an Order should be triggered and filled. This allows Orders to be triggered based on the bid, ask, mid, default (ask for buy, bid for sell) or inverse (ask for sell, bid for buy) price depending on the desired behaviour. Orders are always filled using their default price component.
This feature is only provided through the REST API. Clients who choose to specify a non-default trigger condition will not see it reflected in any of OANDA's proprietary or partner trading platforms, their transaction history or their account statements. OANDA platforms always assume that an Order's trigger condition is set to the default value when indicating the distance from an Order's trigger price, and will always provide the default trigger condition when creating or modifying an Order.
A special restriction applies when creating a guaranteed Stop Loss Order. In this case the TriggerCondition value must either be "DEFAULT", or the "natural" trigger side "DEFAULT" results in. So for a Stop Loss Order for a long trade valid values are "DEFAULT" and "BID", and for short trades "DEFAULT" and "ASK" are valid.

DynamicOrderState.description: The dynamic state of an Order. This is only relevant to TrailingStopLoss Orders, as no other Order type has dynamic state.

id.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

trailingStopValue.description: The Order's calculated trailing stop value.
trailingStopValue.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

triggerDistance.description: The distance between the Trailing Stop Loss Order's trailingStopValue and the current Market Price. This represents the distance (in price units) of the Order from a triggering price. If the distance could not be determined, this value will not be set.
triggerDistance.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

isTriggerDistanceExact.description: True if an exact trigger distance could be calculated. If false, it means the provided trigger distance is a best estimate. If the distance could not be determined, this value will not be set.

Order.description: The base Order definition specifies the properties that are common to all Orders.

id.description: The Order's identifier, unique within the Order's Account.
id.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

createTime.description: The time when the Order was created.
createTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

state.description: The current state of the Order.

MarketOrder.description: A MarketOrder is an order that is filled immediately upon creation using the current market price.

id.description: The Order's identifier, unique within the Order's Account.
id.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

createTime.description: The time when the Order was created.
createTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

state.description: The current state of the Order.

type.description: The type of the Order. Always set to "MARKET" for Market Orders.

instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

units.description: The quantity requested to be filled by the Market Order. A posititive number of units results in a long Order, and a negative number of units results in a short Order.
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

timeInForce.description: The time-in-force requested for the Market Order. Restricted to FOK or IOC for a MarketOrder.

priceBound.description: The worst price that the client is willing to have the Market Order filled at.
priceBound.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

positionFill.description: Specification of how Positions in the Account are modified when the Order is filled.

fillingTransactionID.description: ID of the Transaction that filled this Order (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED)
fillingTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

filledTime.description: Date/time when the Order was filled (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED)
filledTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

tradeOpenedID.description: Trade ID of Trade opened when the Order was filled (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED and a Trade was opened as a result of the fill)
tradeOpenedID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

tradeReducedID.description: Trade ID of Trade reduced when the Order was filled (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED and a Trade was reduced as a result of the fill)
tradeReducedID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

tradeClosedIDs.description: Trade IDs of Trades closed when the Order was filled (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED and one or more Trades were closed as a result of the fill)

items.description: The Trade's identifier, unique within the Trade's Account.
items.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

cancellingTransactionID.description: ID of the Transaction that cancelled the Order (only provided when the Order's state is CANCELLED)
cancellingTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

cancelledTime.description: Date/time when the Order was cancelled (only provided when the state of the Order is CANCELLED)
cancelledTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

createTime.description: The time when the Order was created.

The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

tradeOpenedID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

Specification of which price component should be used when determining if an Order should be triggered and filled. This allows Orders to be triggered based on the bid, ask, mid, default (ask for buy, bid for sell) or inverse (ask for sell, bid for buy) price depending on the desired behaviour. createTime.description: The time when the Order was created.
createTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

state.description: The current state of the Order.

type.description: The type of the Order. Always set to "STOP" for Stop Orders.

instrument.format: A string containing the base currency and quote currency delimited by a "_".

units.description: The quantity requested to be filled by the Stop Order. A posititive number of units results in a long Order, and a negative number of units results in a short Order.
units.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

price.description: The price threshold specified for the Stop Order. The Stop Order will only be filled by a market price that is equal to or worse than this price.
price.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

priceBound.description: The worst market price that may be used to fill this Stop Order. If the market gaps and crosses through both the price and the priceBound, the Stop Order will be cancelled instead of being filled.
priceBound.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.

timeInForce.description: The time-in-force requested for the Stop Order.

gtdTime.description: The date/time when the Stop Order will be cancelled if its timeInForce is "GTD".
gtdTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

positionFill.description: Specification of how Positions in the Account are modified when the Order is filled.

triggerCondition.description:
Specification of which price component should be used when determining if an Order should be triggered and filled. This allows Orders to be triggered based on the bid, ask, mid, default (ask for buy, bid for sell) or inverse (ask for sell, bid for buy) price depending on the desired behaviour. Orders are always filled using their default price component.
This feature is only provided through the REST API. Clients who choose to specify a non-default trigger condition will not see it reflected in any of OANDA's proprietary or partner trading platforms, their transaction history or their account statements. OANDA platforms always assume that an Order's trigger condition is set to the default value when indicating the distance from an Order's trigger price, and will always provide the default trigger condition when creating or modifying an Order.
A special restriction applies when creating a guaranteed Stop Loss Order. In this case the TriggerCondition value must either be "DEFAULT", or the "natural" trigger side "DEFAULT" results in. So for a Stop Loss Order for a long trade valid values are "DEFAULT" and "BID", and for short trades "DEFAULT" and "ASK" are valid.

fillingTransactionID.description: ID of the Transaction that filled this Order (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED)
fillingTransactionID.format: String representation of the numerical OANDA-assigned TransactionID

filledTime.description: Date/time when the Order was filled (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED)
filledTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

tradeOpenedID.description: Trade ID of Trade opened when the Order was filled (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED and a Trade was opened as a result of the fill)
tradeOpenedID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

tradeReducedID.description: Trade ID of Trade reduced when the Order was filled (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED and a Trade was reduced as a result of the fill)
tradeReducedID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

tradeClosedIDs.description: Trade IDs of Trades closed when the Order was filled (only provided when the Order's state is FILLED and one or more Trades were closed as a result of the fill)

items.description: The Trade's identifier, unique within the Trade's Account.
items.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

id.description: The Order's identifier, unique within the Order's Account.
id.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

price.description: The price threshold specified for the Stop Loss Order. If the guaranteed flag is false, the associated Trade will be closed by a market price that is equal to or worse than this threshold. If the flag is true the associated Trade will be closed at this price.

distance.description: Specifies the distance (in price units) from the Account's current price to use as the Stop Loss Order price. If the Trade is short the Instrument's bid price is used, and for long Trades the ask is used.
distance.format: A decimal number encoded as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on what the number represents.

TrailingStopLossOrder.description: A TrailingStopLossOrder is an order that is linked to an open Trade and created with a price distance. The price distance is used to calculate a trailing stop value for the order that is in the losing direction from the market price at the time of the order's creation. The trailing stop value will follow the market price as it moves in the winning direction, and the order will filled (closing the Trade) by the first price that is equal to or worse than the trailing stop value. A TrailingStopLossOrder cannot be used to open a new Position.

id.description: The Order's identifier, unique within the Order's Account.
id.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned OrderID. OANDA-assigned OrderIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that created the Order.

createTime.format: The RFC 3339 representation is a string conforming to https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt. The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

tradeID.description: The ID of the Trade to close when the price threshold is breached.
tradeID.format: The string representation of the OANDA-assigned TradeID. OANDA-assigned TradeIDs are positive integers, and are derived from the TransactionID of the Transaction that opened the Trade.

clientTradeID.description: The client ID of the Trade to be closed when the price threshold is breached.

The Unix representation is a string representing the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1st, 1970 at UTC). The value is a fractional number, where the fractional part represents a fraction of a second (up to nine decimal places).

triggerCondition.description:
Specification of which price component should be used when determining if an Order should be triggered and filled. This allows Orders to be triggered based on the bid, ask, mid, default (ask for buy, bid for sell) or inverse (ask for sell, bid for buy) price depending on the desired behaviour. Orders are always filled using their default price component.
This feature is only provided through the REST API. Clients who choose to specify a non-default trigger condition will not see it reflected in any of OANDA's proprietary or partner trading platforms, their transaction history or their account statements. OANDA platforms always assume that an Order's trigger condition is set to the default value when indicating the distance from an Order's trigger price, and will always provide the default trigger condition when creating or modifying an Order.
A special restriction applies when creating a guaranteed Stop Loss Order. In this case the TriggerCondition value must either be "DEFAULT", or the "natural" trigger side "DEFAULT" results in. So for a Stop Loss Order for a long trade valid values are "DEFAULT" and "BID", and for short trades "DEFAULT" and "ASK" are valid.

trailingStopValue.description: The trigger price for the Trailing Stop Loss Order. The trailing stop value will trail (follow) the market price by the TSL order's configured "distance" as the market price moves in the winning direction. If the market price moves to a level that is equal to or worse than the trailing stop value, the order will be filled and the Trade will be closed.
trailingStopValue.format: A decimal number encodes as a string. The amount of precision provided depends on the Instrument.
